SEARCH
Package board

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
board.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
The `Piece` class represents a chess piece with properties such as position, color, and movement validity check.

    • Piece

      public Piece(int x, int y, boolean alive, boolean white)
      Creates a piece object
      Parameters:
      x - X cord of piece on the board
      y - Y cord of piece on the board
      alive - True if alive, false if not
      white - True if white and false if black

    • validMove

      public abstract boolean validMove(Board board, int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      This abstract method checks if a move on the board from a starting position to an ending position is valid.
      Parameters:
      board - The `board` parameter represents the game board on which the move is being made. It likely contains information about the current state of the game, such as the positions of pieces.
      startX - The `startX` parameter represents the x-coordinate of the starting position of a piece on the board.
      startY - The `startY` parameter represents the starting y-coordinate of the piece on the board where the move is originating from.
      endX - The `endX` parameter represents the x-coordinate of the ending position on the board where the move is intended to go.
      endY - The `endY` parameter represents the y-coordinate of the ending position on the board where the move is intended to go. This parameter is used in the `validMove` method to determine if a move from the starting position `(startX, startY)` to the ending position `(endX, end
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned, indicating whether the move from the starting position (startX, startY) to the ending position (endX, endY) on the board is valid or not.
